channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: Risks and Returns
item.description: This highly readable book contains numerous entertaining anecdotes about, and descriptions of, the lifestyles of the rich and famous. Readers’ interest will never flag as they glean the chunks of wisdom that they can productively apply to investment analysis.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg gave his ex-Facebook engineer startup advice at 2 a.m. over chess—now she’s a founder with over $8.5 million raised in funding
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg told ex-Facebook intern Sophie Novati: ‘Figure out a way to capture people's valuable attention’.

item.title: Florida GOP lawmaker wants to ban smoking on streets, but supports legalizing marijuana
item.description: Smoking and vaping in public in Florida may soon be a thing of the past if a bill by Florida GOP sate Sen. Joe Gruters becomes law. The bill would be introduced if weed in the state is legalized.

item.title: Discarded gender and diversity books trigger a new culture clash at a Florida college
item.description: When hundreds of books got hauled away in a dumpster from the library of the New College of Florida on Thursday, the tiny liberal arts college with a governing board dominated by appointees of Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis once again found itself at the center of the state's culture wars.

item.title: Freedom Sugar and Acid Baths in Maine
item.description: Colby College Museum’s summer shows are smart and packed with good art.

item.title: Georgia Election Board Has One More Chance To Move To Paper Ballots To Safeguard Its Elections, Activists Say
item.description: The fate of the country could potentially hinge on the outcome in Georgia -- it's only fair that the outcome is determined by legitimate votes.

item.title: Opportunities in the Evolving Cannabis Consumption Market
item.description: For investors in the space, the changing cannabis consumption landscape opens challenges and opportunities in product creation, marketing, and targeting new consumer groups.

item.title: European governments are targeting international students to curb surging immigration—but it’s costing universities billions
item.description: In the U.K. alone the total economic benefit from foreign students in 2021-22 was estimated to be £41.9 billion.

item.title: Democratic National Convention: Biden, Obama, Clintons to address the party ahead of Harris' nomination
item.description: Top Democrats, including President Biden and former presidents are headed to Chicago for the Democratic National Convention to celebrate the nomination of Vice President Kamala Harris.

item.title: Wisconsin election officials keep Green Party presidential candidate Jill Stein on ballot
item.description: Wisconsin elections officials dismissed a Democratic National Committee employee's demands Friday to remove the Green Party's presidential candidate from the ballot in the key swing state.

item.title: Iran Is on the Cusp of Producing Nuclear Weapons
item.description: Lawmakers must get answers about what nuclear-weaponization activities Iran has engaged in — and what the Biden–Harris administration is doing about it.

item.title: ESPN Axes Host Days After She Voiced Opposition To Men Competing In Women’s Sports
item.description: ESPN has fired a host who recently voiced opposition to female-identifying men competing in women’s sports. On Thursday, The Athletic reported that ESPN has terminated the contract of “Sunday NFL Countdown” host Samantha Ponder, a longtime reporter for the network who previously covered college football. Former NFL quarterback Robert Griffin III was also fired by […]

item.title: From Sandpiles to Angel Investments
item.description: The presence of power law returns in angel investing, with the potential for significant contributions from a handful of investments, has implications for portfolio construction, investment strategies, and diversification.

item.title: A German diaspora in North Carolina is booming thanks to a multibillion-dollar investment from Germany, but a potential Trump Presidency is causing anxiety
item.description: Thousands of Germans have flocked to North Carolina in recent years, aided by investments from Siemens and Daimler.

item.title: Biden-Harris admin says crime is down, but independent data shows violent crime up across 66 cities
item.description: Despite the Biden-Harris White House's claims of reduced violent crime under their administration, reports show rising crime rates compared to pre-COVID levels.

item.title: Supreme Court rejects feds' request to narrow injunction over its transgender school policy
item.description: The Supreme Court on Friday kept on hold in roughly half the country new regulations about sex discrimination in education, rejecting a Biden administration request.

item.title: The U.S. Military Is Quietly Reinventing Itself on the Great Lakes
item.description: As some of the world’s largest inland seas, the lakes provide the United States with an opportunity similar to that found at Area 51.

item.title: 13th Oregon County To Support Ditching Blue State For Idaho Urges ‘Legislative Action’ On Redrawing Border
item.description: 'Citizens encourage continued discussions with our Idahoan neighbors regarding the possibility of a westward relocation of the Oregon-Idaho border...'

item.title: Book Review: Pause to Think
item.description: This book is direct, delightful, and articulate in suggesting that we take a slow rather than fast approach to getting things thoughtfully done. It touches the minds and hearts of investment professionals.

item.title: Fired CFO’s texts revealed a 10-year affair that led to higher pay and promotions, company says
item.description: The bank launched an investigation in March after an anonymous whistleblower alleged that two executives had been seen “hugging and kissing and exiting the elevators” of a hotel near the office.

item.title: 'We've got their back': GOP nominee in key Senate race touts support for working class voters
item.description: Former Rep. Mike Rogers, the Republican Senate nominee in battleground Michigan, speaks one-on-one with Fox News Digital as he spotlights a populist message.

item.title: Federal subpoenas issued to NYC Mayor Eric Adams, City Hall and campaign in probe of 2021 run
item.description: Federal prosecutors recently issued subpoenas to Mayor Eric Adams, his campaign arm and City Hall in a probe into the Democrat's 2021 run, a new escalation in the ongoing investigation.

item.title: Pope Francis’s Apologia for Literature
item.description: The Vicar of Christ wants you to read more fiction and poetry. Who are you to judge?

item.title: J6 ‘Praying Grandma’ Slammed With Six-Figure Fine And Probation For Walking Around Capitol
item.description: A Colorado grandmother was sentenced to a six-figure fine plus a year of probation for praying at the Capitol grounds on Jan. 6, 2021.

item.title: Is Illiquidity a Blessing in Disguise for Some Investors?
item.description: Rather than running away from illiquidity, investment professionals, investors, and regulators alike should recognize its potential benefits and consider a more balanced approach.

item.title: California Gov. Newsom signs 10 bills targeting flash mobs, theft, and smash-and-grab robberies
item.description: The issue hit a boiling point this year amid mounting criticism from Republicans and law enforcement.

item.title: Newsom signs package to curb smash-and-grab robberies, car thefts
item.description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a bipartisan package of 10 bills in an attempt to reduce smash-and-grab robberies and property crimes in the state.

item.title: Star power expected to light up Democratic National Convention in Chicago
item.description: Hollywood celebrities and musicians will turn out for the Democratic National Convention next week in Chicago, where Vice President Kamala Harris and her running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, will accept their party's respective nominations.

item.title: The Harris Campaign’s Foolish Down-Payment-Assistance Scheme
item.description: Easy credit often harms those it sets out to help — and down-payment assistance is just another form of easy credit.

item.title: The New York Times Is Shocked That Pro-Lifers Are Serious About Protecting Babies At Conception
item.description: There's nothing off-kilter about pro-lifers promising to shield babies from harm and destruction, whether that be abortion or IVF.
